fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4926].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, it is not possible to distinguish between internal or customer facing comment notifications.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add a label to the notification to allow the notification receiver to distinguish internal comments from public comments
h3. Why this is important
For an organization which receives a large number of requests and would like to have a way to distinguish between internal and public comments in order to better triage the notifications, they receive from the Jira Service Desk.
fields.summary: Add Internal comment labels for internal comment notifications

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4925].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Microsoft Outlook 2007/2010 unable to process URLs longer than 1033 characters. Password reset emails can exceed this character limit making the password reset link unusable.

Microsoft TechNet Thread: [Outlook 2010 URL Character Limit|https://social.technet.microsoft.com/Forums/office/en-US/bfbaf146-5f48-42cc-8172-41eb7be2e595/outlook-2010-what-is-the-character-limit-for-a-link-to-open?forum=outlook].
h3. Suggested Solution

Find ways to shorten the URL so that Outlook 2007/2010 can handle them.
h3. Why this is important

Many customers are using Outlook 2007/2010 as their default mail client.
h3. Workaround

Use a web browser or another email client.
fields.summary: Long links/URLs don't work in Outlook 2007/2010

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4923].
  {panel}

We purchased JIRA Service Desk for our customers to be able to do self service by searching our Confluence Knowledge Base. The problem is the Customer Portal display window to see the Knowledge Base articles is tiny and the screen shows vertical and horizontal scroll bars.

 

This is a terrible user experience and quite frankly renders the use of both Confluence and JIRA Service for Customer self service useless.

 

We are considering alternative solutions to solve this basic problem that we consider a major product limitation.

 

Please advise if we can increase the size of the window that displays the knowledge article to customers and it would also be beneficial to allow users to click on an image and have it open up in full view just like Confluence does - not sure why you have these important features for employee facing users of Confluence and remove them for self service Customers in JIRA Service Desk.
fields.summary: Jira Service Desk Customer Portal is too small to view Knowledge-base articles

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JSD, if a workflow transition can be triggered on Customer Portal, a popup asking for an optional comment is displayed when customer triggers that transition.
However there is no option in JSD/Workflow settings that can make this comment field mandatory.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option in JSD or Workflow settings that allows administrator to make this comment field mandatory.
fields.summary: Allow JSD to make comment required on transition in Customer Portal

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4919].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access any SDS project
# Navigate through the SDS queue
# Edit one of the queues and try to rename to an already existing one
# No message will be displayed and it would like the application isn't processing the request

h3. Expected Results
As you're tying to rename a specific queue to an existing one, a message should be displayed as "A queue with that name already exists." 

h3. Actual Results
No message is displayed in the UI, however and if you open the developer tools within the web browser, JIRA will return the status code  400 with the response below (Only visible in the developer tools):
- {noformat}{"errors":[{"errorMessage":"A queue with that name already exists."}],"reasonKey":"sd.admin.queue.create.error.duplicate","reasonCode":"400"}{noformat}
 
h3. Notes 
When you try to create a new queue (instead of editing an existing one) and add a name that already exists, the application will return the following in the UI:
* A queue with that name already exists
fields.summary: Rename a SDS queue to a queue that already exists does not trigger any message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4911].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Starting with Service Desk 3.3.0 the *Subject* of Service Desk notifications no longer appears to automatically vary with the action being notified about.

For example, in JSD 3.1.x, if an Agent resolved a ticket, the Customer would receive a notification with a Subject like this: {quote}[Prefix] Request resolved as "Done" #EXAMPLE-3: test request{quote}

However in JSD 3.3.0 this behavior changed and the equivalent action results in a notification with a subject as follows, using the default template: {quote}EXAMPLE-3 test request{quote}

For reference the default template is: {code:borderStyle=solid}${issue.key} ${issue.summary}{code} 

The only variables available for the *Subject* are: 
* Issue key
* Issue summary
* Portal name

h3. Suggested Solution
Make additional variables available to refer to the action being performed.

This may not be sufficient, however, as there are cases where multiple actions are placed into a single notification, in which case I'm not sure how that would work. 

h3. Why this is important
Filtering notifications is much easier when notifications for different events carry different subjects.
fields.summary: Allow additional customization of customer notification email's subject line

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, SD customers only have the ability to search for articles from the customer portal. The returned result will be based on the searched keywords.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Create an option of displaying a dashboard where the user can browse KB documents according to labels or according to an index with a dynamic filter search bar on top. It would be great as well if the number of returned results is at least 10.
# Create a macro template in Confuence that can be added to a document which is then used as an index to enable the user to browse KB files.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the indexing language is not the same as the language that has been used during installation, JSD projects creations breaks with errors.
# New SD projects have many errors, statuses, customer notifications, and empty queue page. 
# Creating a sample project results in errors in regards of importing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start up an instance in English and create a business project at startup.
# In settings change indexing language to Spanish.
# Create a JSD project:
#* Create a sample project.
*OR*
#* Create other JSD projects with approvals.

h3. Expected Results
The new JSD project should be created without errors.

h3. Actual Results
For the 1st scenario, we can see the following in atlassian-jira.log:
{noformat}
c.a.j.p.i.i.importer.impl.AbstractDataImporter$1Thread[http-nio-8080-exec-1,5,main]] Importing issue: [externalId='null', summary='Photo editing software request']
2017-01-30 18:29:01,438 http-nio-8080-exec-1 WARN eseidel 1109x3317x1 1ticebt 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/jira-importers-plugin/1.0/demo/create 
{noformat}
This is an example of one of the issues that is being imported (it will show up in the screen shot later). Immediately after, the following warning is thrown:
{noformat}
2017-01-30 18:29:01,438 http-nio-8080-exec-1 WARN eseidel 1109x3317x1 1ticebt 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/jira-importers-plugin/1.0/demo/create [c.a.j.p.i.i.importer.impl.AbstractDataImporter$1Thread[http-nio-8080-exec-1,5,main]] Custom Field [ Customer Request Type ] was not found and cannot be created
{noformat}
That's followed by:
{noformat}
2017-01-30 18:29:01,488 http-nio-8080-exec-1 ERROR eseidel 1109x3317x1 1ticebt 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/jira-importers-plugin/1.0/demo/create [c.a.j.p.i.i.importer.impl.AbstractDataImporter$1Thread[http-nio-8080-exec-1,5,main]] Error importing issue [externalId='null', summary='Photo editing software request']
com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.external.ExternalException: Status [ Erledigt ] does not have a linked step in the [ jira ] workflow. Please map to a different status.
{noformat}
The issues are actually imported however:
{noformat}
2017-01-30 18:29:02,139 http-nio-8080-exec-1 INFO eseidel 1109x3317x1 1ticebt 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/jira-importers-plugin/1.0/demo/create [c.a.j.p.i.i.importer.impl.AbstractDataImporter$1Thread[http-nio-8080-exec-1,5,main]] 40 issues successfully created
{noformat}

For the 2nd scenario, new SD projects have many errors, statuses, customer notifications, empty queue page such as:
{noformat}
Request Form contains configuration errors
The following fields don't have any values set:
¿Qué sistema?
As a consequence these Request Forms cannot be used successfully by customers:
Solicitar una nueva cuenta
To repair these Request Forms, add values for these fields on this project's components page.
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
* Change the indexing language back to English which is the same as the system language, run a full re-indexing and then create a Service Desk project
fields.summary: Fix translated string compare to english for statuses

fields.description:
h3. Summary
New requests are not created in JIRA Service Desk projects when using API

h3. Environment
* JSD Version 3.2.x Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# The "Create Issue" post function is used to create a new request in JSD.

h3. Expected Results
The issue is created and can be accessed

h3. Actual Results
The issue is created, however the transaction fails and the issue is rolled back

Error received in response to the call: 
{noformat}
org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericTransactionException: Commit failed, rollback previously requested by nested transaction.
{noformat}

h3. Notes
The same code used to work perfectly in JSD version 3.1.10. The problem started with JSD version 3.2.x.

h3.Workaround
no workaround available
fields.summary: New requests are not created in JIRA Service Desk projects when using API

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4904].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When there's too many projects within your instance (~2000) and you access the *ViewProjects.jspa* (JIRA Administration > Projects) with the administrator account, the page takes many minutes to load and there's a high consume of RAM to render the page.

However, this is not caused when accessing *BrowseProjects.jspa* (Projects > View All Projects) as it contains pagination and also a filter between the project types.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add pagination or a specific filter on *ViewProjects.jspa* such as *BrowseProjects.jspa*

h3. Why this is important
 
Avoid performance issues.
fields.summary: Improve the performance of ViewProjects.jspa

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4901].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 19 Mar 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue.

In [JSD 4.12|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagement/jira-service-desk-4-12-x-release-notes-1019396559.html#JiraServiceDesk4.12.xreleasenotes-confluence] we shipped a new way of integrating JSM Server with Confluence Cloud. You can read all about how to [set up a knowledge base with Confluence Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/set-up-a-knowledge-base-with-confluence-cloud-1018775526.html] in our documentation.

Please note that we're currently looking into a related configuration issue where Knowledge Base articles can't be opened in the customer portal if Confluence Cloud is not configured with anonymous access, which you can track at [JSDS-7175|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-7175].

Kind regards,

Charlie

Jira Service Management, Server & Data Center
{panel}

{panel:title=Response 15 March 2017}
Hi all,

Thanks for your responses.

We understand that this is a significant change for some of you. As part of making authentication and single sign-on easier across Atlassian products we have consolidated product access through Atlassian account ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-account-for-users-873871199.html]). This means that access to our products outside the customer portal requires an Atlassian account.

Customers can still search for KB articles, view articles, bookmark articles and so on using the customer portal. This does not require an Atlassian account as it's done through the customer portal.

If you need your customers to *directly* access Confluence to browse through KB articles, you can either:
 # Make your space anonymous-accessible. This will mean that anyone will be able to browse your KB articles without needing to log in. If you are experiencing issues as described in CONF-30161 then please make sure you have linked your space to a JIRA Service Desk project via Project Settings → Knowledge Base as this fixes the problem.
 # If you do not want to make your space anonymous accessible, ie. you want customers to explicitly log in before they can see Confluence, then you must convert your customer user accounts to Atlassian accounts. You can convert them yourself using the instructions on [https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/select-the-right-account-for-your-jira-service-desk-customers-873871210.html] or you can file a support ticket and our support can bulk migrate your customer accounts to Atlassian accounts. Having an Atlassian account does not consume a license.

 

JIRA Service Desk Team
{panel}
h3.  
{panel:title=Response 13 March 2017}
Hi all,

This is expected behavior. Updating our accounts meant we had to shuffle things around a bit.

Your agents have a single account for all your Cloud products. But, your customers are special. They may not recognize Atlassian and we don't want to confuse them.

To keep your organization's branding on your help desk articles, we recommend sharing knowledge base links to your customers via the customer portal. Your customers can search for and read help articles in the portal, without needing to learn Confluence, and they don't leave your help desk experience.

Your agents can link customers to this view, and avoid linking them to Confluence. To provide a portal view of articles to your customers in an issue comment:
 * View the customer issue.
 * Under Related knowledge base articles, select the article to share or select Search knowledge base.
 * Preview the article and select Share as comment.

If you want your customers to browse all of your Confluence space, we recommend migrating them to Atlassian account. If you migrate them, they can log into your Confluence space, browse the page tree, and read articles. But, they will need to learn what Atlassian is and use our log in and account management screens. We don't recommend this for teams who serve external customers. [Learn how to migrate customers to Atlassian account|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/select-the-right-account-for-your-jira-service-desk-customers-873871210.html].

Another potential workaround is to open your Confluence space for anonymous view access, this will allow any user to view your Confluence knowledge base space without logging in. [Learn how to enable anonymous access to a Confluence space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-give-non-confluence-users-access-to-a-space-779166002.html].
 - JIRA Service Desk Team{panel}
h3. Summary

Portal users cannot access knowledge base on a cloud instance that authenticates via [https://id.atlassian.com|https://id.atlassian.com/].
h3. Environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - On an instance with SSO enabled (id.atlassian.com), create a service desk project linked with a Confluence knowledge base.
 - Enable unlicensed access : *Project Settings > Knowledge base > All active users and customers can access the knowledge base without a Confluence license.*
 - Create a portal only user via the Customers page in the Service Desk project.
 - Let the portal only user log in the portal.
 - Access the direct link to the knowledge base article (ie https://<instance>.atlassian.net/wiki/display/SK/KP_Page).

h3. Expected Results

Portal only user should be able to open the page.
h3. Actual Results

Portal only user will be requested to authentic via SSO (id.atlassian.com). Login will either fail or reply with a permission error :
{noformat}
Your account doesn't have access
Looks like you don't have access to this site. If you think you should have access, contact your administrator.
If you would like to use a different email address on this site you can switch accounts.
{noformat}
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

Share the knowledge articles as comments in the service desk ticket.

*On the Service Desk agent interface* :
 - Access the ticket : https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/browse/<TicketID>.
 - Click on an article under *Related knowledge base articles* or click on *Search for Knowledge Base* to search for an article.

!kb articles.png|thumbnail!
 - Click "Share as a Comment"

!share as comment.png|thumbnail!

*On the Service Desk portal user interface* :
 - The link will be displayed in the comment.
 - Click on the link and a view of the article will be shown within Service Desk.

!portal user view.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Portal users cannot access the knowledge base

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4897].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

!test.png|thumbnail!

A customer saw queues taking up to 20s to load (with 35 queues in a single projects). This was because the count issues method uses jql search using {{LuceneSearchProvider}} in JIRA core to count issues for any queue. Issues for all queues are counted at page load, queue update, add issue and the polling on the queues page, to show the issue count lozenge on the left hand panel.
h3. Suggested Solution
 # store the project specific setting using the {{GlobalPropertyDao}}
 # currently issue count is done by JQL search in JIRA core
 # QueueServiceImpl accepts a bool to shouldCount for queues
 # CustomQueuesItemProvider:getqueues provides a true value for shouldCount
 # QueueAssemblerImpl:getQueues provides a shouldCount value that is passed through API call and that is false by default.

h3. New experimental settings
As of 3.4.2 there will be a new experimental admin REST api available to set whether the queue count should be included on the Queues page.

A global setting that can be set by JIRA admin is available:
{code}
PUT <contextpath>/rest/servicedeskapi/admin/queues/include-count - true/false body - 200 response (default true)
{code}

There is also a project level setting that can be set by either a JIRA or Project Admin.
{code}
PUT <contextpath>/rest/servicedeskapi/admin/queues/<projectkey>/include-count - true/false body - 200 response (default true)
{code}

NB: If the global setting is off, then queue count will not be enabled for any project, as it will take precedence.

(!) This is an experimental api and therefore as it may be moved, or replaced in the future, until it becomes public, will require opt-in with the [Experimental-API|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/cloud/#special-headers] header


h3. Workaround
 # Reduce the amount of queues per project
 # Simplify the JQL search in each queues (avoid using SLA check when possible)
fields.summary: Loading issue count is slow when there are many queues in single project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

This issue came from [PS-10718|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/PS-10718] where the customer saw a ~ 2 hour delay in automation rules on new issues created. The cause that automation is placed on the scheduler which takes too long to execute it. 
h3. Environment
 * ServiceDesk 3.2.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create rules.
 # Trigger the rule (for example create an issue) 1x per second from jmeter
 # Make sure rules are processed slower than JIRA events are propagated.
 # See that, the rule has delay, and delay is increasing (the more rules and the slowest the rules are and the more triggers incoming - the longer delay)

h3. Expected Results

ServiceDesk Automation rule should not be using JIRA scheduler that can be stacked with other services.
h3. Actual Results

Servicedesk Automation rule kicks out 1-2h after the issue creation.

!image-2017-03-06-14-00-31-855.png|width=488,height=151!
h3. Workaround
 * remove the slowest rules, or
 * slow down mail handler (if it's possible).
fields.summary: Long delay in automation rule

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4894].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
As an admin, I would like the ability to blacklist specific groups from a given Service Desk Role.

h3. Why this is important
This would prevent project admins from accidentally adding large groups (e.g. jira-users) to Roles (e.g. Service Desk Agents). This has the ability to create mass outgoing emails in large enterprise environments when a ticket is created and affect JIRA performance.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to blacklist certain groups from adding to roles.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like the ability to blacklist specific groups from a given Role

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4893].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When a customer is trying to visualize comments we could provide a way to segregate a view to show only internal comments, all comments, and external comments, there could be a button on the _issue tab panel_ to exhibit only internal comments, this way agents, and service desk administrators can have more control about the restricted comments and not get mixed up with customers inputs.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
It would be nice to:
# Have an additional button to view only restricted/internal comments.
OR
# Three buttons one that shows all comments (as current) another to show internal/restricted and a third button to show only customers comments.

h3. Workaround 

For Cloud, there is no current add-on nor plugin to achieve that.
fields.summary: Create a button on the issue tab panel to view only internal comments

fields.description:
h3. Summary

After upgrading to JSD 3.3.2, all JSD related pages including Customer Portal are blank in IE 11
h3. Environment

IE 11
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Upgrade to JSD 3.3.2.
 # Access to any JSD projects using IE 11.

h3. Expected result

No empty page should be shown when access to JSD project related pages like Queues, Customers, Reports, Customer Portal and etc.
h3. Actual result

All JSD related pages are empty, except issue view.
 !IE11.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
h6. Option 1. Use other browsers

Using Chrome, Firefox, Safari or Edge will make the web pages display properly
h6. Option 2. Update the files within {{jira-servicedesk-3.3.2-REL-0010.jar}} that are causing the issue
{panel:title= Important: Please read first}
(!) * Backup your JIRA directory before attempting this workaround.
 * You will need a copy of *jar* which is bundled with Oracle Java *JDK* 8 to re-create the jar file.{panel}
JIRA Server
 # Shutdown JIRA
 # Extract out the contents of {{[$JIRA_HOME|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Home+Directory]/plugins/installed-plugins/jira-servicedesk-3.3.2-REL-0010.jar}} to a temporary directory (e.g. {{/tmp/atlassian-jira-servicedesk-3.3.2}})
 # Edit {{sd.portal.api.bundle.js}}
Search and replace all from {{"() =>"}} to {{"function()"}} - without the quotes
 # Edit {{sd.project.api.bundle.js}}
Search and replace all from {{"() =>"}} to {{"function()"}} - without the quotes
 # Re-create the JAR
 {{jar cfm /tmp/jira-servicedesk-3.3.2-REL-0010.jar ./META-INF/MANIFEST.MF *}}
 # Copy the newly created {{/tmp/jira-servicedesk-3.3.2-REL-0010.jar}} into {{[$JIRA_HOME|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+Home+Directory]/plugins/installed-plugins/jira-servicedesk-3.3.2-REL-0010.jar}}
 # Start JIRA

In Microsoft IE 11 Browser
 # You *must* Clear the Browser Cache otherwise it will not work

 * If clearing the cache doesn't work, try also SHIFT + REFRESH in the browser
fields.summary: All Service Desk-related pages are not loading in IE 11 in JSD 3.3.2

h3. Summary

In JIRA SD, if you go to *Customers* > *Add customers* and add a new customer, they will be automatically included in the "Service Desk Customers" Project Role.

But if you Add the user inside an Organization (either by clicking *Organization* > *Add customers* or *Customers* > *Add customers* and selecting the organization in the dropdown below the "Add customers") they WILL NOT be automatically added to the "Service Desk Customers" Project Role.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

See above.
h3. Expected Results

Customers added should be automatically included inside the project role *Service Desk Customers*
h3. Actual Results

Customers added inside an Organization are not automatically included inside the project role.
h3. Workaround

Manually add every customer to the project role.
fields.summary: Users created inside an Organization are not automatically included in the "Service Desk Customers" Project Role

fields.description:
h3. Description of problem

Documentation for [Installing JIRA Service Desk |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER033/Installing+JIRA+Service+Desk] only tells of running the full installer which will install JIRA Service Desk as a separate JIRA installation. This does not include any directions for customers who already have JIRA installed and wish to add JIRA Service Desk to their existing installation.

This causes confusion. Customers believe that they must run the installer to install JIRA Service Desk when they would rather have it added to their existing JIRA installation.
h3. Expectations:

Documentation includes directions that apply to both installation scenarios.
 # Install JSD as new JIRA installation
 # Install JSD as an additional application on an existing JIRA installation

h3. Workaround

Refer to [Installing additional applications and version updates |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer073/Installing+additional+applications+and+version+updates] for directions on installing JIRA Service Desk into an existing JIRA instance.
fields.summary: "Installing JIRA Service Desk" documentation does not include directions for installing onto existing JIRA instance

h3. Problem Definition
Service Desk is primarily focused on Help desk scenarios. In Many cases "Queue Managers" want to differentiate from the time a ticket comes in and when it gets assigned.

h3. Summary
When trying to edit a SLA goal, the calendar is set to "24/7 Calendar" automatically when user click on the goal.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Basic Service Desk project
# Navigate to *Project settings > SLAs*
# Edit "Time to resolution" SLA
# Modify the "priority = Highest" rule by changing its goal
# Modify the "All remaining issues" rule by changing its goal
# Now go back and try to modify "priority = Highest" rule again (see the screencast below)
 [^2017-03-02_17-28-33.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results
The Calendar of the "priority = Highest" rule remains in "Sample 9-5 Calendar"

h3. Actual Results
The Calendar of the "priority = Highest" rule gets changed to "24/7 Calendar"

h5. Issue Summary

When an issue is replied to by an agent, we would like to be able to get  a count so we can generate a report that can be used to get an average of how many replies are needed to resolve an issue.

h5. Existing Feature:

None as JIRA Service Desk does not have a feature that allows counting of replies.

h5. Suggestion

A counter can be provided to check either how many comments are added to each issue by an agent or how many times an issue transitioned to {{Waiting For Customer}} or other public transitions that lets the customer see the changes.
This can then be recorded in a field and used to generate a report.
fields.summary: Add the ability to Count Amount of Times Responded

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4877].
  {panel}

Hi!

We are developing an Outlook app for JIRA and we allow our customers to create ServiceDesk requests on behalf of customers from Outlook. We also support to provide additional fields, which will be available on the resulting issue, by updating it afterwards.

To render the mask correctly, we need the RequestType to IssueType mapping, which is unfortunately not available via the public API currently. We are using the following call as of now, but we are not sure how long this will continue to work:

/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/[key]/groups/[id]/request-types

for example: [https://yasoon.atlassian.net/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/bs/groups/8/request-types]

Would it be possible to add the issueType to the following call?:
/rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/[id]/requesttype

Thanks!
Tobi
fields.summary: Return the IssueType for a Request Type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4873].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

As a JIRA Core or JIRA Software user who has been added to the *Service Desk Team* role in a Service Desk Project, I can collaborate on Service Desk Requests.

However, I am not able to use the Organization-related JQL functions in the Issue Filter to search for requests. If I attempt to use the {{organizationMembers()}} function, I receive the error:
{quote}You must be an agent to use the Customer Organization JQL functions.
{quote}
If I attempt to perform a search using the *Organizations* field, I receive the error:
{quote}You don't have permission to access this Service Desk.
{quote}
 
h3. Suggested Solution

Expose the Organization JQL tools to Service Desk Collaborators
h3. Why this is important

Companies may want to use Organizations to organize their Customers but not want to make all the Developers full-fledged Service Desk Agents in order to make it possible to sort Requests by Organization.
h3. Workaround

One option is to update the *Application access* so that the Collaborators take up a Service Desk license and are instead Service Desk Agents.

Another approach may be to use an add-on to implement a post function to copy the Organization to another Custom Field.
fields.summary: As a Service Desk Collaborator I want to be able to use Customer Organization JQL functions

h3. Problem Definition

When creating a ticket through email, all members of the organization are added by default.  This causes notifications for people in the organization, who the reporter may not wish to be included.

h3. Suggested Solutions

Create a project level default setting to specify whether email notifications are shared with the organization or made private.

h3. User level Solution
On a per-customer basis, there should be the following options:
# use the project default
# notify all members
# notify only reporter
# notify specific members [list]
# notify all members except: [list]

h3. Workaround

See additional feature request https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-4543 for disabling all notifications, except Reporter.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Agents are forbidden from adding an existing customer to an Organization with the error in the screenshot below.
 !permission.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to reproduce the problem
# Ensure that the configuration to allow agents to manage organization via *Administration > Applications > JIRA Service Desk configuration* is set to _Yes, agents can add and remove organizations from projects, and add and remove customers from organizations_
# Disable the outgoing mail server.
# Log in as an Agent and add an existing customer to an Organization.

h3. Expected result
The Agent is not able to add the customer to the Organization with relevant error about Outgoing mail configuration

h3. Actual result
The Agent is not able to add the customer to the Organization and the misleading error about permission is thrown

h3. Notes
An Agent will not be able to invite a customer to an Organization if any of the conditions below is true
* The configuration to allow agents to manage organization via *Administration > Applications > JIRA Service Desk configuration* is set to {{No, only JIRA administrators can manage organizations}}
* The Outgoing Mail Server is not configured 
* The Outgoing Mail is disabled

h3. Workaround
* Ensure that the Outgoing Mail Server is configured and enabled
* Admins can add customer to an Organization without a working Outgoing Mail Server
fields.summary: Misleading error about Agents do not have the permission to add a customer to an Organization

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4868].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In a Service Desk project, when *Who can customers share requests with?* is set to *Any customer, by typing an email address*, customer need to type the email address with exactly the same case as stored in JIRA in order to share with that customer.

h3. Environment
* JSD 3.3.x

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project
# Create two SD customer : customerA and customerB with email address "tEStAccount@localhost.com"
# Make sure the *Customer permissions* has been set as following:
 !2017-02-28_customer-permissions.png|thumbnail! 
# Login to customer portal with customerA and raise a new ticket.
# Try to share the ticket with customerB by entering the email address (in lower case) "testaccount@localhost.com"

h3. Expected Results
customerB is added as request participant of the ticket

h3. Actual Results
The below error is shown :
 !2017-02-28_share-error.png|thumbnail! 

Note: The error may quickly disappear due to JSDSERVER-5516
 
h3. Notes
* If customerA enters the email address with the exact case, then customerB can be added as request participant without any problem.
* This issue cannot be reproduced in a JSD 3.2 instance.

h3.Workaround
Set *Who can customers share requests with?* to *Any customer or organization, by searching in this project* so that when user types email address JSD will auto-complete the input.
fields.summary: Email address becomes case sensitive when sharing ticket with other customer since JSD 3.3.0

Currently, we can manage Service Desk customer list by adding user group into the Service Desk project's {{SERVICE DESK CUSTOMERS}} role. 

But to manage customers on the Organization level, we will need to add user one by one which is not an efficient way of maintaining the list when there is a huge change in the company's user management.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Service Desk's Organization to accept user groups.

h3. Problem Definition
Customers using the "Forgot your password?" link from the Customer Portal receive an email that looks like it is using Service Desk Notifications as the template, that is, using this text in the footer:{quote}Help Center sent you this message, powered by JIRA Service Desk{quote}

However, these do not appear to be customizable like notifications for a specific Service Desk are.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the request type is set to a non-latin word, in some cases, the search by "Customer Request Type" returns error. This issue is more like an regression in JSD as it cannot be reproduced in JSD 3.2.x

h3. Environment
* JSD 3.3
* Database encoding/collation settings are configured as recommended
* JIRA and JVM's encoding related properties are set to UTF-8

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a sample Service Desk with the project key = "SITP"
# Change the name of a request type to "Шаблонные сайты"
# Change the name of another request type to "解决 系统问题"
# Open issue navigator and execute the following JQLs :
{code}
"Customer Request Type" = "解决 系统问题 (SITP)" 
{code}
{code}
"Customer Request Type" = "Шаблонные сайты (SITP)" 
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Both JQL get executed without any error.

h3. Actual Results
The first JQL returned correct result :
 !2017-02-24_jql-ok-chinese.png|thumbnail! 
but the second failed with following error
 !2017-02-24_jql-error.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
On JSD 3.2, when user picks the request type from auto suggestion list, the value is converted into a key :
 !2017-02-24_jsd-3.2.png|thumbnail! 
on JSD 3.3 the value is not converted and it remains as what we see in the suggestion list :
 !2017-02-24_auto-suggestion.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Use the following SQL (tested for PostgreSQL) to identify the key of each request type and use it in the JQL instead:
{code}
select vp."KEY" || '/' || vpf."KEY" as key, vpf."NAME" 
from project p inner join "AO_54307E_VIEWPORT" vp on p.id=vp."PROJECT_ID" inner join "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFORM" vpf on vp."ID"=vpf."VIEWPORT_ID" 
where p.pname='<project name>';
{code}
fields.summary: Error in searching by "Customer Request Type"

h3. Summary
When attempting to create a JIRA service desk project the creation fails and users receive the following error:

"Hmm... we couldn't create your project due to an unknown error. Try refreshing the page to start again."

h3. Environment

Cloud - JIRA Service Desk Application v3.3.0-OD-1000.940.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change the name of any issue type that's used by service desk and already exists.
# e.g: Change the 'Sub-task' issue type name to 'Sub-Task'
# Try to create a service desk project

h3. Expected Results
The project should be created.

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the JIRA log file:

{code}
2017-02-23 13:24:54.187883500 2017-02-23 13:24:54,127 http-nio-2993-exec-23 ERROR sysadmin 804x11495x1  104.192.142.137 /rest/project-templates/1.0/templates [c.a.j.project.ProjectCreateRegistrarImpl.privacy-safe] The handler with id com.atlassian.jira.project-templates-plugin:apply-project-template-handler threw an exception while handling a notification about a project being created

2017-02-23 13:24:54.187885500 java.lang.IllegalStateException: An issue type with the name 'Sub-task' exists already.

2017-02-23 13:24:54.187886500 at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultIssueTypeManager.createIssueTypeAndAddToDefaultScheme(DefaultIssueTypeManager.java:130)

2017-02-23 13:24:54.187928500 at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultIssueTypeManager.createIssueTypeAndAddToDefaultScheme(DefaultIssueTypeManager.java:160)

2017-02-23 13:24:54.187929500 at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultIssueTypeManager.createIssueType(DefaultIssueTypeManager.java:93)

2017-02-23 13:24:54.187929500 at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)

2017-02-23 13:24:54.187935500 at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)

2017-02-23 13:24:54.187935500 ... 1 filtered
{code}

h3. Notes
This only happens when you're trying to create your first project.

h3. Workaround
 - Change the issue type that was modified, changing the name back to default.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

  {panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 24 March 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}

Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue.

After investigating this request further, we believe it has been incorrectly categorised as a feature suggestion rather than a bug. Jira Service Management notifications are currently not respecting the [global Jira setting for ‘email from’|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-jira-application-options-938847824.html#ConfiguringJiraapplicationoptions-settingsGeneralsettings].

We understand that this issue can cause confusion for your customers and it is an issue we would like to resolve. Thank you for your votes and comments on this ticket, it has surfaced it for our attention.

The related public bug ticket ([JSDSERVER-3597|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-3597]) will be reopened and triaged accordingly - please follow progress on that ticket.

Kind regards,

Charlie

Jira Service Management, Server & Data Center{panel}

h5. Issue Summary

I am set *Email from* setting to be without exact name, and be always the same (for example, +MCC RU - IT SUPPORT+). 

Usual notifications JIRA turned off in project. But customer notifications turned on (we like it for easy template editor)

But customer's notifications receiving with fullname of the operator, who make action.

How can i hide operator name?
JIRA SD 3.3.0

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Service Desk project.
# Go to {{Admin > System > General Configuration}} page.
# Click *Edit Settings*.
# In the *Email from* field, change the option to something else e.g 
{code}
{email}, {email.hostname}, (Some Text)
{code}

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA Service Desk would use this setting when it sends out notifications to customers.

h5. Actual Behavior

JIRA Service Desk seems to use the username of the person who performed the change whereas JIRA projects respect the change.

h5. Observation

As JIRA Service Desk notification is different from the normal one used by JIRA, could this be because this is hard-coded and this is the expected behavior?
fields.summary: Email From setting doesnt work with customer notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a Service Desk is configured for only "Customers who are added to the project" the *Customers* page will still display users as customers (and grant access to the Customer Portal) if the users has the following permissions for the Project:
* Browse Projects
* Create Issues

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup JIRA with at least one user besides an administrator
# Create a Service Desk Project
# Confirm that it is set to "Customers who are added to the project" for Customer permissions/Request security 
# Modify the Permissions scheme to grant Browse Project and Create Issues to the other user
# View the *Customers* page for the Service Desk

h3. Expected Results
The other user is not listed as a Customer.

h3. Actual Results
The other user is listed as a Customer, they can log in to the Customer Portal (though with limited functionality,) and this breaks other functionality such as Automation Rules that work based on whether the action was performed by a Customer instead of a collaborator.   Moreover, the Customer can't be removed from the list of Customers via Users and Roles as would normally be expected. 
 
h3. Notes
I only tested with specific user permissions grants and "Application Access - Any logged in user", I also don't know why this doesn't appear to list the admin as a customer, since they obviously have those permissions and then some. Presumably it is overridden somehow by being in a role such as Agent or Administrator. 

h3.Workaround
Adjust permissions not to grant these permissions, relying instead on setting up Agents, Customers, and Collaborators in the "normal" ways, detailed in [Setting up Service Desk users|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER033/Setting+up+service+desk+users]
fields.summary: Customers Role ignored when specific permissions granted to users

Our business would benefit greatly by having automation rules for organizations on all 'if' conditions like Comment Added, Issue Created, Status Changed etc.

ie. Alert Organization

Or alternatively an automation rule that allows for Users and Organizations to be added as watchers.

This is essential because many of the Service Desk requests we receive require notice to other organizations within the company. While users can add them manually, there is human error and once an organization is added, unless members add themselves as participants, no further notifications are sent.

h3. Summary

The 'Quick Search Bar/buttons' in the top bar of JIRA appear in different locations in IE compared to Firefox/Chrome.

To the untrained user, the 'Quick Search Bar/buttons' appears _missing_ when it is actually present in the far right of the Browser window.
h3. Environment

N/A
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA Service Desk 3.2.7 (or the latest 3.3.1 version)
 # Create an 'IT Service Desk' project with sample data
 # Once logged in, go to Projects > click on the newly created Service Desk project
 # Click on 'Queues' on the left menu
 # Click on the 'Edit Queue' button on the right
 ** Add lots of columns (i.e. Description, Priority, Progress, Rank, Project, Resolution, Watchers, Labels, etc..)
 ** Press Save
 # View the above Queue view in IE, Firefox and Chrome

h3. Expected Results

The 'Quick Search Bar/buttons' in the top right bar should appear in the same location independent of the web browser.
h3. Actual Results
 # In Firefox/Chrome - the 'Quick Search Bar/buttons' in the top bar are pushed to the right. User has to scroll across to get to them
 # In IE - the 'Quick Search Bar/buttons' in the top right bar cling to the browser window

(See attached screen shots below)

h3. Notes

N/A
h3. Workaround

The workaround provided is to advise the user to scroll to the right to get access to the 'Quick Search Bar/buttons' or reduce the number of columns if possible.
fields.summary: Position of Quick Search Bar and Buttons appears differently in IE compared to Firefox/Chrome

If a JSD agent is working on a ticket for a customer and goes to their address bar to send the link to a customer, it'll be jira.example.com/browse/JSDPROJECT-123

If a JSD customer goes to this link, they're given a giant warning as they should be using jira.example.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/X/JSDPROJECT-123 which an agent needs to get by going to the "View Customer Request" link on the RHS

 

It would be IDEAL if the agent link was used by a customer, that it checked if the user was a legitimate customer for that request and redirected them to the customer request view automatically.

 

Obviously if the user did not have access to JSDPROJECT-123, then throw the same error.
fields.summary: Automatically redirect JSD customer to customer portal link if agent link is used

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

If a user is using a Service Desk project that has a workflow that has a screen on the transition event, the screen does not come up.

h5. Affected Version

JIRA Service Desk 3.1.9 and 3.3.0

In both cases, these were fresh JIRA instances with no other data.

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a service desk project of type IT Project.
# Create a new Screen *Approve*
# Add any field to the screen.
# Modify the Change Workflow.
#- This by default has the approve/deny transitions.
# Add the screen created to the approve and deny transitions.
# Publish the workflow and reindex JIRA.
# Create a new issue in JIRA service desk(portal or UI).
# Attempt to approve or deny the issue.

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA would show you the workflow screen you configured to allow you enter expected values(e.g. Comments).

h5. Actual Result

JIRA would automatically perform the transition without the screen ever showing up.
fields.summary: Screens on Approve/Deny Service Desk Transitions do not appear

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Attach a screenshot with to-be-submitted comment in Text mode will remove the comment from the Commend field.

h3. Steps to reproduce the problem
# Create an issue from JIRA in a Service Desk project.
# Copy a screenshot to clipboard.
# Search for the issue created in step 1 via 
#* the Issue Navigator, URL will be like {{http://localhost:8080/browse/DESK-1?jql=}}
#* the Queue, URL will be like {{http://localhost:8080/projects/DESK/queues/custom/1/DESK-1}}
# Type something in the comment in the Text mode, do not submit the comment.
# Paste the image (Ctrl + V).
# Upload the screenshot in the pop-up screen.

h3. Expected result
Screenshot will be uploaded, the comment remains in the Comment box with the wiki markup link of the screenshot at the end of the comment text

h3. Actual result
Screenshot will be uploaded, however, the comment is dismissed

h3. Notes
This does not happen to issues in Business or Software projects.

h3. Workaround
* Use Visual mode for the comment
* Do not search for the issue via the Issue Navigator, open the issue via the menu {{Issues > Recent issues}}.
** The URL will be like {{http://localhost:8080/browse/DESK-1}}.
fields.summary: Attach screenshot by pasting an image from the clipboard removes the draft comment in Text mode

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

When a user creates a workflow transition and adds the condition  *Hide transition from user*, JIRA Automation rules which use this transition would not be triggered.

(i) _It is important that the transition is triggered by an automation because they want the issue to be closed if no updates after a while, however they must use a different transition from the one visible to users because the ones visible to users have required fields that prevent the transition from being used. _

h5. Steps to Reproduce.

# Create a JIRA project.
# Edit the workflow reusing the transition that closes the issue, linking it between the first status the issue gets to upon creation (Waiting for Support) and Resolved Status.
# Add a condition to the transition: *Hide transition from user*
# Publish the Workflow.
# Create a new Automation Rule:
|*When*|Issue Created|
|*IF*|Issue Matches: summary ~ 'test'|
|*THEN*|Transition Issue:<_Your transition from the first status to Close_>|
# Create an Issue.

h5. Expected 

The automation rule would be able to automatically close the ticket.

h5. Actual Behavior

The automation rule would not be able to execute and close the ticket. This I suspect is because the automation rule is being run as a particular user.
fields.summary: Workflow Condition Breaks JIRA Automation Rule

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the subject of incoming mail contains a line feed and is encoded in UTF-8 with base64, Service Desk mail processor will not be able to create a new ticket from this email.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a SD mail channel.
# Send a test email with a subject that contains a line feed. 
# Verify the raw source of the incoming email :  the subject is encoded in UTF-8 with base64, as shown in example below
{code}
Subject: =?utf-8?B?VGhpcyBpcyB0aGUgMyBTdWJqw6hjdCAKIExpbmUgd2l0aCBicmVhayE=?=
{code}

h3. Expected Results
A ticket is created from the incoming email.

h3. Actual Results
Following error is thrown by mail processor asking for a valid value for the "summary" field:
 !2017-02-15_mail-audit2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Though the error message complains that there is no valid value for the "summary" field, from the screenshot, we can see that the *Mail subject* is correctly parsed.
The issue cannot be reproduced with JIRA mail handler.

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: JSD cannot handle email with subject which is encoded in UTF-8 with base64 and contains a line feed

h3. Problem Definition

 
 {color:#333333}Currently, in the Customer notifications setting, the default rules has the selection of "Reporter(customer)" and "Customer involved"  in {color}the *To* field, except some rules, such as "Organization added" rule. 

!Screen Shot 2017-02-15 at 14.33.01.png|thumbnail!

Same issue with the "Send Email" action in the Automation Rule configuration:
 !Automation_SendEmailRule.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Adding the feature to select the recipients of Organisation group in the To field (in both the Customer Notifications, and the Automation rules)

h3. Workaround

Nothing in particular.
fields.summary: Add the possibility to select "Added Organization" for the recipients in the Customer notifications and automation rules
